title: i cannot log in
body:
stuck at "logging on"

then shows an error message saying my internet cannot connect to the pvp.net server

i try uninstall/reinstall resetting router/modem

north america

i live in san  antonio texas

using time Warner cable 200mb download speed

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update:

ok i can log in but very bad news i join a game we all  pick our champ but loading screen pop up and would not connect

so i got a lost and now i got punished and have to wait 20 minute to queue up for game (4 times 20 minutes each)

replies.body: does anyone live in Texas?
meee, + i have twc :/

At least 30 people live in Texas. 

I mean probably.
http://33.media.tumblr.com/98e941055a72a64c8e258b5e3ce9c192/tumblr_nj0d5cuWq01smcbm7o1_250.gif
i live in texas and also have the same problem :l , TWC
me i live in san antionio cannot log in with time warner 200mb too =(

Can you try something for me? Try changing your DNS server to Google's public one. 

Directions if you don't know how:
Go into Network and Sharing Center
Click "Change adaptor settings"
Right-click on the adaptor you're connect with (It'll usually have your network's name right under the adapters name) and click Status
Now go into properties and find "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)" and double click it
Change the option from "Obtain DNS server address automatically" to "Use the following DNS server addresses"
Put in the top one "8.8.8.8" and for the alternate put "8.8.4.4"
Click okay, then click okay in the properties window too.

I want you to try this because I want to see if your ISP is just having trouble translating Riot's server addresses.
I do and same problem
I do too and also have twc
so it let me log in but it won't let me connect to my game
same here....   I hope I don't get punished for a bad connection between riot's servers and our IPs, we had no way of knowing this would happen and it sucks...
I also live in San Antonio, Tx and I just ran into the same problem. I too am having issues logging on. I was playing fine yesterday or the day before.
and still not fixed.  this is obviously a networking issue that needs resolved between the client "Riot" and the ISP "TWC" in Texas.
I live in Tx San Antonio have TWC and can log in now (i had this problem too)
This is were we all get leavers ban. There goes my winning streak.

they have fixed the problem, go back to playing league of legends guys. 

thumb this up so people who go back to this page and see that its back up can continue playing league.
hey every 1 i can log in now looks like they fix it!
Yeah WTFast allows it to work, but no chat servers
in the trace route the hop is stopping at tbone.rr.com meaning that twc or riot is having some sort of issue routing their dns.  have changed my dns to google and am having the same issue.

I'm  ready to call some support numbers to get this fixed. I'm in Texas and I would like to do something  about this. Please write a number,  or someone I can speak to. I will be on the phone with them if you can point a way for me. Yes, I have TWC, but I dont know if calling TWC and saying "Why wont the league of legend server connect  " is going to do anything
Haha probably not. I'm wondering if this has anything to do with the way things might have been updated with ISPs when Windows 10 rolled out.
Log in as an Administrator.
Already Tried man, it's nothing to do with the users here.

I'm having same issue...I am also a texas time warner customer.  I have ports forwarded, everything disabled (firewalls, using manual ipv4 DNS, etc.), internet explorer not offline and security opened up.  

So frustrating given I dealt with this a few months ago and had to go through every single step to fix it.  I eventually did, and my computer is still configured exactly the same.  I tried flushing DNS and RE INSTALLING the stupid client.  FUCK TIME WARNER.  Please someone help us, call time warner and complain for hours.  I have a job I can't at the moment.  LOL

i dont know if im the only one but i had problems with league way before it stopped letting me log in. first i was seeing a bunch of my champions repeating when ur looking at them in champ select. i saw zed three times, where veigar was supposed to be and where twitch was supposed to be. i also saw wukong but he wasnt wukong he was MonkeyKing. in loading screen it read MonkeyKing too. only when i entered the game was it wukong again. then league started glitching so i closed and i never was able to login again after that. this was 3 days ago so... yeaaaaa :(
here are my trace route findings
was there anything u guys did before your league client started working because mine still isnt {{champion:32}}

Update your graphics drivers, worked for me.

I just switched to Windows 10, and it didn't do that for me; so connected to the game took minutes after it had started, and when I got in I was running at 5 fps.
Had the same problem the other day, I just finished the low priority queue ._.

I encountered this problem a while ago as well.
Try changing your DNS.
Follow the instructions on this website: https://www.opendns.com/

But we cant do anything about it. Thats just how it is for us East Coast plebs.

I mean, I've gotten low Priority queue for dcing during a bot match... for 5 minutes.
